intro: Chrysodium gaboonense, commonly known as the Gaboon goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes many aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, golden-yellow foliage and small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and understudied species.
